Microwaves (the actual waves) being used to heat your food ar just plain NOT going to harm you (unless you put your head in the oven and cook it). Like epaphras_faith said, they just excite the water (and oils) and get it hot.
 
 Now, I have no idea whether they have some extra ability to liberate components of dishware into your food, but I would say that if the plate, plastic, or whatever you are cooking on doesn't get hot, then I can hardly imagine that it would release anything into your food.
 
 Again, cooking on a stove with teflon coated pans will probably do more damage, even though teflon is pretty chemically inert.
 
 I will say that I've heard bad things about cooking with aluminum, especially with acidic foods (which would leach aluminum into it). The same thing happens with iron pots and pans, but iron is good for you.
